connect4

Class Connect4Network

  • java.lang.Object
    • connect4.Connect4Network

  • public class Connect4Network
extends java.lang.Object
    This class encapsulates the network functions of the Connect4 program.

    Functions include starting a network connection as a server or client, sending and receiving a Connect4MoveMessage between connected a connected server or client, and closing the network connection.

    Additionally error information can be retrieved in the by invoking the getErrorMessage() method.

    Author:
    Kristopher Rangel

    • Constructor Detail

      • Connect4Network

        public Connect4Network(boolean isServer,
                       java.lang.String server,
                       int port)
        Constructor.

        This constructor starts a server connections or client connection as appropriate on the given port.

        Parameters:
        isServer - - whether a server connection should be established
      • if True, a server connection will be established
      • if False, a client connection will be established
        • server - - the hostname
        port - - the port number

    • Method Detail

      • startServer

        private boolean startServer(int port)
          startServer

            private boolean startServer ()

          Creates a server connecting accepting clients.

          If an exception occurred while trying to establish the connection, false is returned. In the event false is returned, the error message can be retrieved by invoking getErrorMessage().

        Returns:
        true if no exception, false otherwise

      • startClient

        private boolean startClient(java.lang.String server,
                            int port)
          startClient

            private boolean startClient (String server, int port)

          Creates a client connection and attempts to connect to the specified server.

          If an exception occurred while trying to establish the connection, false is returned. In the event false is returned, the error message can be retrieved by invoking getErrorMessage().

        Parameters:
        server - - the host name, or null for the loopback address.
        port - - the port number
        Returns:
        true if no exception, false otherwise

      • closeConnection

        public boolean closeConnection()
          closeConnection

            public boolean closeConnection ()

          Closes the connection created by this class.

          If an exception occurred or an attempt was made to close a null connection, false is returned. In the event false is returned, the error message can be retrieved by invoking getErrorMessage().

        Returns:
        true if no exception, false otherwise

      • writeMessage

        public boolean writeMessage(Connect4MoveMessage message)
          writeMessage

            public boolean writeMessage (Connect4MoveMessage message)

          Writes a Connect4MoveMessage to the output buffer of this connection.

          If an exception occurred while trying to establish the connection, false is returned. In the event false is returned, the error message can be retrieved by invoking getErrorMessage().

        Parameters:
        message - - the Connect4MoveMessage to transmit
        Returns:
        true if no exception, false otherwise

      • readMessage

        public Connect4MoveMessage readMessage()
          readMessage

            public Connect4MoveMessage readMessage ()

          Reads a Connect4MoveMessage from the input buffer of this connection.

          If an exception occurred while trying to read the message, null will be returned. In that event, the error message can be retrieved by invoking getErrorMessage().

        Returns:
        - the Connect4MoveMessage read, or null if an exception occurred or no input exists

      • getStartError

        public boolean getStartError()
          getStartError

            public boolean getStartError ()

          Returns error status of network startup.
        Returns:
        True if there was an error during startup, false otherwise

      • getErrorMessage

        public java.lang.String getErrorMessage()
          getErrorMessage

            public String getErrorMessage ()

          Returns the network error message associated with the last network error.
        Returns:
        a String representing the message associated with the last occurring network error.
